title: Ohio's 9th congressional district - Wikipedia
snippet: Ohio's 9th congressional district has been represented by Representative Marcy Kaptur (D) since 1983.

title: Ohio's 9th Congressional District - Ballotpedia
snippet: This is the 9th Congressional District prior to the 2010 redistricting. See also: Redistricting in Ohio after the 2010 census · The Ohio State Legislature approved a new map of the congressional districts based on updated population information from the 2010 census. Because of redistricting, Kaptur faced a primary challenge from Rep. Dennis J. Kucinich, who formerly represented Ohio's 10th district.[22] On March 30, 2012, the National Journal released a list of the top ten most contorted congressional districts.[23] The 9th District was on the list.[23]

snippet: Marcy Kaptur, the Representative from Ohio - in Congress from 1983 through Present. Currently serving Ohio District 9

title: Marcy Kaptur - Wikipedia
snippet: In 1982, while pursuing her doctorate degree, Kaptur was recruited by local Democratic leaders to run for Congress in Ohio's 9th district in the midterm elections. The seat was held by freshman Republican Ed Weber, who had unseated 26-year incumbent ...
